locus

Class Chromosome

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractSet<E>
        • java.util.TreeSet<Fragment>
          • locus.Chromosome
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<Fragment>, java.util.Collection<Fragment>, java.util.NavigableSet<Fragment>, java.util.Set<Fragment>, java.util.SortedSet<Fragment>

    public class Chromosome
extends java.util.TreeSet<Fragment>
    Class chromosome. It contains the information of the Fragments that have not yet coalesced. The Fragments are maintained as a sorted list and cannot overlap.
    See Also:

      • comesFrom

        public boolean comesFrom(Chromosome a1,
                         Chromosome a2,
                         double mutation_rate,
                         double recombinationRate,
                         int totalSequences)
                  throws ExceptionFragment
        Do the recombination backward in time using the chromosomes a1 and a2
        Parameters:
        a1 - parental chromosome one
        a2 - parental chromosome two
        mutation_rate - the mutation rate per site and generation of the chromosome
        recombinationRate - the recombination rate by bp of the chromosome
        totalSequences - the total number of simulated sequences. A fragment is excluded when it contains all the possible simulated sequences (no need to add more mutations, all the sequences will be monomorphic derived)
        Returns:
        Throws:
        ExceptionFragment

      • addOffspringChromosome

                                   double mutation_rate)

        Collapse the chromosome
        Parameters:
        a - the offspring chromosome
        totalSequences - the number of total sequences
        mutation_rate - the mutation rate
